public abstract class zeta.util.VerboseWriter

(source file: VerboseWriter.pizza)
java.lang.Object
   |
   +----zeta.util.VerboseWriter
The pure class interface. 
public abstract class VerboseWriter
A class for managing verbosity prints.

Provides several methods for convenient printing of verbosity messages. By default, verbosity messages are send to standard out. It is possible to statically configure another output channel or a session to receive the verbosity messages.

Verbose printing itself is done on an instance of a VerboseWriter -- when creating such an instance, it is decided on base of a parameter whether verbosity prints are actually done or not.

Typical usage is as follows: 

 class MyClass {
   static VerboseWriter verb = VerboseWriter.make(toolName, verboseCond);

   .... {
      verbose.send("reaching foo");
      ...
      verbose.send("reaching bar");
      ...
   }
 }

Version: $Id: VerboseWriter.pizza,v 1.1 1998/09/13 15:09:17 wg Exp $

VerboseWriter
public VerboseWriter();

setReceiver
public static void setReceiver(PrintWriter writer);
Set the given print-writer to be used for all verbose messages. An older print-writer or session is overwritten as a receiver.

setReceiver

public static void setReceiver(Session session);
Set the given session to be used for all verbose messages. An older print-writer or session system is overwritten as a receiver.

make

public static VerboseWriter make(Name name,
                                 boolean active);
Return an instance of a verbose writer, using the given tool name in session messages. If the given boolean is true, then the returned verbose writer will issue its messages to the currently configured receiver. Otherwise all output to the returned verbose writer will be ignored.

make

public static VerboseWriter make(Name name,
                                 String property);
Return an instance of a verbose writer, using the given tool name in session messages. If the given property string is defined in the system property set, then the returned verbose writer will issue its messages to the currently configured receiver. Otherwise all output to the returned verbose writer will be ignored.

send

public abstract void send(String message);
Send the given string to this verbose printer.

send

public abstract void send(Format format);
Send the given format to this verbose printer.

isActive

public abstract boolean isActive();
Return true if this is an active verbose writer.

  extends VerboseWriter
